intro: Parnassia foliosa var. nummularia, commonly known as the silverleaf parnassia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, waxy hairs. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
